body_html:
I´ve seen multiple reports of this, but haven´t been able to reproduce this, so I bought several clean Pi 3s with Jessie SD cards to experiment with. On my first one, I´m still not seeing the issue, so I suspect thereś something I´m missing with my approach. To narrow it down, here are my complete steps copied from my bash history:

mkdir ~/projects
 cd ~/projects/
 git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
  cd tensorflow/
  tensorflow/contrib/makefile/download_dependencies.sh
  sudo apt-get install autoconf automake libtool
  cd tensorflow/contrib/makefile/downloads/protobuf/
  ./autogen.sh
  ./configure
  make
  sudo make install
  sudo ldconfig
  cd ../../../../..
  sudo apt-get install -y gcc-4.8 g++-4.8
  make -f tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile HOST_OS=PI TARGET=PI OPTFLAGS="-Os -mfpu=neon-vfpv4 -funsafe-math-optimizations -ftree-vectorize" CXX=g++-4.8
  sudo apt-get install -y libjpeg-dev
  make -f tensorflow/contrib/pi_examples/label_image/Makefile
  curl https://storage.googleapis.com/download.tensorflow.org/models/inception_dec_2015_stripped.zip -o /tmp/inception_dec_2015_stripped.zip
   unzip /tmp/inception_dec_2015_stripped.zip -d tensorflow/contrib/pi_examples/label_image/data/
   tensorflow/contrib/pi_examples/label_image/gen/bin/label_image

This runs as expected, and produces military uniform as the top result, with no malloc error.

The outpout of uname -a is Linux raspberrypi 4.1.19-v7+ #858 SMP Tue Mar 15 15:56:00 GMT 2016 armv7l GNU/Linux.

Can someone who´s seeing this issue give my steps above a try and let me know if they see the error still?

body:
I´ve seen multiple reports of this, but haven´t been able to reproduce this, so I bought several clean Pi 3s with Jessie SD cards to experiment with. On my first one, I´m still not seeing the issue, so I suspect thereś something I´m missing with my approach. To narrow it down, here are my complete steps copied from my bash history:

``` bash
mkdir ~/projects
 cd ~/projects/
 git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
  cd tensorflow/
  tensorflow/contrib/makefile/download_dependencies.sh
  sudo apt-get install autoconf automake libtool
  cd tensorflow/contrib/makefile/downloads/protobuf/
  ./autogen.sh
  ./configure
  make
  sudo make install
  sudo ldconfig
  cd ../../../../..
  sudo apt-get install -y gcc-4.8 g++-4.8
  make -f tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile HOST_OS=PI TARGET=PI OPTFLAGS="-Os -mfpu=neon-vfpv4 -funsafe-math-optimizations -ftree-vectorize" CXX=g++-4.8
  sudo apt-get install -y libjpeg-dev
  make -f tensorflow/contrib/pi_examples/label_image/Makefile
  curl https://storage.googleapis.com/download.tensorflow.org/models/inception_dec_2015_stripped.zip -o /tmp/inception_dec_2015_stripped.zip
   unzip /tmp/inception_dec_2015_stripped.zip -d tensorflow/contrib/pi_examples/label_image/data/
   tensorflow/contrib/pi_examples/label_image/gen/bin/label_image
```

This runs as expected, and produces military uniform as the top result, with no malloc error.

The outpout of `uname -a` is `Linux raspberrypi 4.1.19-v7+ #858 SMP Tue Mar 15 15:56:00 GMT 2016 armv7l GNU/Linux`. 

Can someone who´s seeing this issue give my steps above a try and let me know if they see the error still?
